result.execSummary:
The defendant Savannah R. Heitman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,428.92 and restitution surcharges.
*NOTE: $1,428.92 has been paid in full and will be disbursed to the victims through the Clerk of Courts Office.
----------------------------------

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.
----------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH H.N. OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL CONTACT AT SCHOOL.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
